Provision.Text: Whereas, pursuant to section 42.1 of the Tobacco Acta, the Minister of Health laid a copy of the proposed Tobacco Reporting Regulations, substantially in the annexed form, before the House of Commons on May 12, 2000 and the House of Commons concurred on June 8, 2000 in a report from the Standing Committee on Health approving the proposed Regulations;

Therefore, Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Health, pursuant to sections 7 and 33 of the Tobacco Acta, hereby makes the annexed Tobacco Reporting Regulations.

Section.Text: The definitions in this section apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: accredited representative means a person who is entitled to the tax exemptions specified in Article 34 of the Convention set out in Schedule I to the Foreign Missions and International Organizations Act or Article 49 of the Convention set out in Schedule II to that Act. (représentant accrédité)
Act means the Tobacco and Vaping Products Act. (Loi)
brand means all of the brand elements that as a whole are used by a manufacturer to identify to a consumer a tobacco product made by the manufacturer. (marque)
cigar includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a cigarillo or cheroot; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any roll or tubular construction intended for smoking that consists of a filler composed of pieces of natural or reconstituted leaf tobacco, a binder of natural or reconstituted leaf tobacco in which the filler is wrapped, and a wrapper of natural or reconstituted leaf tobacco. (cigare)

Definition.Text: cigarette includes any roll or tubular construction that contains tobacco and is intended for smoking, other than a bidi, cigar, kretek or tobacco stick. (cigarette)
constituent means a constituent listed in column 1 of Schedule 1. (constituant)
consumer tobacco product means any of the following types of tobacco product that is for use by a consumer:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cigarettes;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cigarette tobacco;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: leaf tobacco;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: cigars;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: pipe tobacco;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: tobacco sticks;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: smokeless tobacco;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: kreteks;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: bidis; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: any kit. (produit du tabac pour consommation)

Definition.Text: designated tobacco product means any of the following types of consumer tobacco product:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cigarettes;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cigarette tobacco;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: leaf tobacco;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: tobacco sticks; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: kreteks. (produit du tabac désigné)

Definition.Text: duty free shop has the same meaning as in subsection 2(1) of the Customs Act. (boutique hors taxes)

emission means, in the case of an emission contained in mainstream smoke, an emission listed in column 1 of Schedule 2 and, in the case of an emission contained in sidestream smoke, an emission listed in column 1 of Schedule 3. (émission)
equivalent unit means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of cigarette tobacco, a cigarette prepared in accordance with the method set out in the Canadian General Standards Board standard CAN/CGSB-176.1-92, entitled Preparation of Cigarettes from Cigarette Tobacco for Testing, dated December 1992; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of leaf tobacco, a cigarette prepared in accordance with Official Method T-401, entitled Preparation of Cigarettes from Leaf Tobacco for Testing, made by the Department of Health, dated December 31, 1999. (unité équivalente)

Definition.Text: identical products means tobacco products that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contain identical ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are manufactured in an identical manner;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: have identical dimensions; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: perform in an identical manner under the same conditions. (produits identiques)

Definition.Text: ingredient means any substance or material used in the manufacture of a tobacco product, and includes an additive. (ingrédient)

kit means a package that includes a tobacco product referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (i) of the definition consumer tobacco product together with another tobacco product, which products are intended to be assembled by a consumer for their use. (trousse)
mainstream smoke means the smoke that is drawn through the port of a smoking machine when a tobacco product is placed in the machine and combusted. (fumée principale)
manufacturer includes an importer of tobacco products. It does not include a manufacturer that only packages or that only distributes tobacco products on behalf of another manufacturer. (fabricant)
sidestream smoke means the smoke, other than mainstream smoke, that leaves a tobacco product when the product is placed in a smoking machine and combusted. (fumée latérale)
smokeless tobacco means chewing tobacco and snuff. (tabac sans fumée)
type of package includes each size of the following types of packages:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of bidis, cigarettes, kreteks and tobacco sticks,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a slide and shell package,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flip-top package, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a soft package;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of cigarette tobacco and pipe tobacco,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a pouch,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a can, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a tub;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of cigars,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a tube,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flip-top box,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a soft package, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a bundle; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of smokeless tobacco, a plastic or metal container. (type d’emballage)

Definition.Text: type of tobacco includes the following types of tobacco commonly known as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: Virginia flue-cured;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: Maryland;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: Burley; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: Oriental. (type de tabac)

Definition.Text: unit means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a cigarette;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a cigar;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a tobacco stick;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a kretek; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a bidi. (unité)

Section.Text: Every provision of these Regulations that applies to a brand of tobacco product also applies to every size of that brand.

Subsection.Text: Every report made under these Regulations must be submitted to the Minister in writing or in an electronic format and must set out, in addition to the information required by these Regulations, the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, street address and telephone number of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the manufacturer on whose behalf the report is made, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person who makes the report;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the street address of the manufacturer’s principal place of business in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the street address of the place of business where the tobacco product that is the subject of the report was manufactured;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the report;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the period covered by the report;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of any tobacco product that is to be reported, its type and brand; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the section of these Regulations under which the report is made.

Subsection.Text: Every report made under Parts 2, 3, 4 and 5 shall be based

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on data obtained from the analyses of tobacco products performed during the period to be reported on; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on activities undertaken by or on behalf of the manufacturer during that period.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), the results of the tests referred to in subsection 14.2(6) must be submitted to the Minister in an electronic format that is acceptable to the Minister, based on the following criteria:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister must have access to the test results;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister must be able to electronically process the test results without having to re-copy or re-enter them; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister must be able to clearly identify the test result data.

Section.Text: Any person who makes a report under these Regulations shall attach to the report an attestation that states that the information in the report is true and complete to the best of the knowledge and belief of that person and is provided in good faith.

Subsection.Text: Any laboratory that performs an analysis on which a manufacturer relies for the purposes of these Regulations shall be accredited under the International Organization for Standardization standard ISO/IEC 17025, first edition, dated December 15, 1999, entitled General Requirements for the Competence of Testing and Calibration Laboratories.

The document entitled Scope of Accreditation issued by the Standards Council of Canada to the laboratory referred to in subsection (1) or any other equivalent document that is evidence of the laboratory’s accreditation shall specify the method used to perform the analysis referred to in subsection (1).

Section.Text: Despite sections 12 and 14, a laboratory may use a method that is not provided for in these Regulations (in this section referred to as an “alternative method”) to collect information if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the use of the alternative method results in information that is at least as accurate and precise as the information that would be produced if the method provided were used; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the laboratory submits a description of the alternative method to the Minister together with data that demonstrate that the requirements of paragraph (a) have been met.

Section.Text: Where any information to be provided in a report made under Parts 2 to 5 is urgently required for any of the purposes set out in section 4 of the Act, the Minister may, in writing and with reasons, request that a manufacturer provide the information before the day on which the report is required to be submitted.

Where additional information is required for any of the purposes set out in section 4 of the Act, the Minister may, in writing and with reasons, request that a manufacturer provide any additional information that is related to information provided in a report made under these Regulations, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any report made by a laboratory that is the basis for a report made under these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any information relating to a research activity reported under Part 4, including a copy of any document for which a cover page was included.

Section.Text: For the purposes of sections 6 and 7, the manufacturer shall provide any additional information within 30 days after the Minister’s request is sent or at such later date as may be fixed by the Minister if the Minister determines that more time to comply with the request is necessary because of the complexity of the request or because new analyses or calculations are required to satisfy the request.

Subsection.Text: Every manufacturer shall report the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their name, street address and telephone number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the street address of each establishment where they manufacture a tobacco product;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a list of every consumer tobacco product that they manufacture, by brand and by each type of package and carton of the brand, and, in the case of a kit, a list of every tobacco product contained in it; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a list of consumer tobacco products that they manufacture that are identical products sold under different brands, including an indication of which of the products are identical.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Samples of packages, cartons, and kits
Subsection.Text: Every manufacturer shall provide to the Minister, for each brand of a consumer tobacco product that they manufacture, a sample or reasonable facsimile of each type of package, carton and kit.
Every manufacturer of a consumer tobacco product shall, within 90 days after the coming into force of these Regulations, provide the following to the Minister:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information described in subsection (1); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the samples or facsimiles described in subsection (2).

Subsection.Text: If the information reported under subsection (1), or anything provided under subsection (2), is changed by the manufacturer, the manufacturer shall, within 30 days after the change is made,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: advise the Minister of the change in the information; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide the Minister with a copy of the changed package, carton or kit.

Subsection.Text: Every manufacturer shall provide to the Minister, by brand, their manufacturing procedures for each of their consumer tobacco products.
The manufacturing procedures shall be provided

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a consumer tobacco product being manufactured at the time these Regulations come into force, within 90 days after that coming into force date; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any other consumer tobacco product, on or before the day on which the manufacturer begins to manufacture that consumer tobacco product.

Subsection.Text: If a manufacturer changes a manufacturing procedure, the manufacturer shall provide the new procedure to the Minister within 30 days after the change is made.
Every manufacturer of a consumer tobacco product, a paper, a tube or a filter shall report, quarterly, by brand and type of tobacco, the information described in subsections (2) and (3).
The report shall set out the total quantity and cost of every ingredient

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: purchased in the quarter;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: used in the quarter; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: stored, on the date the report is made.

Subsection.Text: The report shall set out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a bidi, cigarette, cigar, tobacco stick, or kretek, its weight in milligrams per unit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of each ingredient in a consumer tobacco product, a paper, a tube or a filter,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its common, chemical and commercial names,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, its biological origin, in standard Latin nomenclature,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the registry number assigned to it in accordance with the Chemical Abstracts Service of the American Chemical Society,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the mean, standard deviation and 95% confidence limit of the amount of it in milligrams

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: per gram of the consumer tobacco product, paper, tube or filter, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in the case of a bidi, cigarette, cigar, tobacco stick or kretek, per unit of the product,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and street address of its supplier,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: its country of origin,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of tobacco, its type,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a paper, its type and specifications, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a filter, a description of it, its specifications and pressure drop and, with respect to nicotine for those brands analyzed pursuant to subsection 14(13), its efficiency, determined in accordance with Official Method T-106, entitled Determination of Filter Efficiency in Mainstream Tobacco Smoke, made by the Department of Health, dated December 31, 1999; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of each component of an ingredient in a consumer tobacco product, a paper, a tube or a filter

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its commercial, common and chemical names,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, its biological origin, in standard Latin nomenclature,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the registry number assigned to it in accordance with the Chemical Abstracts Service of the American Chemical Society,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the mean, standard deviation and 95% confidence limit of the amount of it in milligrams

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: per gram of the ingredient and of the consumer tobacco product, paper, tube or filter, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: in the case of a bidi, cigarette, cigar, tobacco stick or kretek, per unit of the tobacco product,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and street address of its supplier, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: its country of origin.

Subsection.Text: The report shall be submitted

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for the period beginning on January 1 and ending on March 31 of a year, on or before April 30 of that year;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the period beginning on April 1 and ending on June 30 of a year, on or before July 31 of that year;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for the period beginning on July 1 and ending on September 30 of a year, on or before October 31 of that year; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for the period beginning on October 1 and ending on December 31 of a year, on or before January 31 of the following year.

Subsection.Text: The report is not required for a consumer tobacco product if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the product is one of identical products of the manufacturer sold under different brands; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a report under this section is submitted in respect of another of those identical products.

Subsection.Text: Every manufacturer of a consumer tobacco product shall report annually, by brand and type of tobacco, the information described in subsection (7) for the consumer tobacco product. The report shall, subject to subsection (2), be submitted on or before January 31 of the year following the year to be reported on.
The initial report, relating to the portion of the year remaining of the year in which these Regulations come into force, shall be submitted within the later of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: January 31 of the year following the year these Regulations come into force, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 180 days after these Regulations come into force.

Subsection.Text: Every manufacturer shall use the applicable method listed in column 2 of Schedule 1 to collect information about a constituent.
A sample used for the purpose of determining the amount of a constituent must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: selected in accordance with the procedures described in items A and B of Table 1 of the International Organization for Standardization standard ISO 8243, second edition, dated 1991-10-15 and entitled Cigarettes — Sampling; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prepared in accordance with Official Method T-402, entitled Preparation of Cigarettes, Cigarette Tobacco, Cigars, Kreteks, Bidis, Packaged Leaf Tobacco, Pipe Tobacco and Smokeless Tobacco for Testing, made by the Department of Health, dated December 31, 1999.

Subsection.Text: The mean, standard deviation and 95% confidence limit of the amount of each constituent must be based on three replicates of a sample.
The amount of each constituent must be corrected for moisture in accordance with AOAC Official Method 966.02, entitled Moisture in Tobacco, Gravimetric Method, made in 1968.
The report shall set out the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of bidis, cigarettes, cigars, tobacco sticks and kreteks, the weight in milligrams per unit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of each constituent in the consumer tobacco product;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the mean, standard deviation and 95% confidence limit of the amount of each constituent in milligrams, micrograms, or nanograms

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: per gram of the consumer tobacco product, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of bidis, cigarettes, cigars, tobacco sticks and kreteks, per unit; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the pH of the consumer tobacco product, determined in accordance with Official Method T-310, entitled Determination of Whole Tobacco pH, made by the Department of Health, dated December 31, 1999.

Subsection.Text: The report is not required for a consumer tobacco product if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the product is one of identical products of the manufacturer sold under different brands; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a report under this section is submitted in respect of another of those identical products.

Subsection.Text: The report is not required for the following tobacco products where the total sales of the manufacturer for the year preceding to the year covered by the report are less than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cigars, 1,000,000 units per brand; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of pipe tobacco, 8000 kg per brand.

Subsection.Text: A manufacturer may, instead of submitting the report described in subsection (1) or (2) for a consumer tobacco product, submit a report on the amount of nicotine, nitrosamines, nickel, lead, cadmium, chromium, arsenic, selenium and mercury in the product if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of cigarettes, cigarette tobacco and tobacco sticks, including any cigarettes, cigarette tobacco or tobacco sticks sold in kits, the manufacturer’s total sales for that product in the year preceding the period covered by the report is less than 1% of the total sales of that product in that year in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of leaf tobacco, bidis and kreteks, the manufacturer’s total sales for that product in the year preceding the period covered by the report is less than 5% of the total sales of that product in that year in Canada.

Subsection.Text: If clove, clove extract or eugenol has not been added to a consumer tobacco product, the manufacturer of the product need not analyze it for the constituent of eugenol.
Every manufacturer of a consumer tobacco product shall report the information described in subsection (3) in respect of the following categories, by brand and by each type of package of the brand:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in each province;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in each duty free trade customer and operator;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: as ships’ stores in accordance with the Ships’ Stores Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: to accredited representatives; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for export, by country of destination.

Subsection.Text: Every importer of a consumer tobacco product to be sold at a duty free shop shall report, by province, the information described in subsection (3) by brand and by each type of package of the brand in respect of each duty free shop.
The information in respect of the sales of a consumer tobacco product for each category described in subsection (1) and (2) shall be reported as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of bidis, cigarettes, cigars, tobacco sticks and kreteks,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by unit, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by number of packages sold, specifying the type of package, the number of units in a package, and the dollar value of the total sales of each type of package;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of kits

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by number sold,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by weight, in kilograms, of tobacco contained in each kit,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, by the number of papers, tubes or filters included in each kit, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: by the number of units intended to be made;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of cigarette tobacco, by weight in kilograms of tobacco in each specified type of package; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of any other consumer tobacco product

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by weight in kilograms of the consumer tobacco product, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by number of packages sold, specifying the type of package, the weight of the tobacco product in the package and the dollar value of the total sales of each type of package.

Subsection.Text: The report shall be submitted

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for cigarettes, cigarette tobacco or tobacco sticks, on or before the 15th day of each month, for the previous month; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for every other consumer tobacco product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for the period beginning on January 1 and ending on March 31 of a year, on or before April 30 of that year,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the period beginning on April 1 and ending on June 30 of a year, on or before July 31 of that year,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the period beginning on July 1 and ending on September 30 of a year, on or before October 31 of that year, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: for the period beginning on October 1 and ending on December 31 of a year, on or before January 31 of the following year.

Subsection.Text: Every manufacturer of a designated tobacco product shall report the information described in subsections (2) and (7), by brand and type of designated tobacco product, in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the emissions contained in the mainstream smoke produced from the combustion of the designated tobacco product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the emissions contained in the sidestream smoke produced from the combustion of the designated tobacco product.

Subsection.Text: The report shall, in respect of the emissions contained in the mainstream and sidestream smoke produced from a cigarette, tobacco stick, kretek or equivalent unit of a designated tobacco product that is placed in a smoking machine and combusted, identify the emission and set out the mean, standard deviation and 95% confidence limit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: of the number of puffs;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: of each emission, expressed in milligrams, micrograms or nanograms per unit or equivalent unit; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: of the weight of tobacco contained in the designated tobacco product expressed in milligrams per unit or equivalent unit.

Subsection.Text: A sample to be used for the purpose of determining the amount of an emission must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: selected in accordance with the procedures described in items A and B of Table 1 of the International Organization for Standardization standard ISO 8243, second edition, dated 1991-10-15 and entitled Cigarettes — Sampling; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: conditioned and smoked in an environment as described in the International Organization for Standardization standard ISO 3402, third edition, dated 1991-07-01 and entitled Tobacco and Tobacco Products — Atmosphere for Conditioning and Testing.

Subsection.Text: The mean, standard deviation and 95% confidence limit of the amount of each emission must be based

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of tar, nicotine and carbon monoxide, on 20 replicates of a sample; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in every other case, on 7 replicates of a sample.

Subsection.Text: Every manufacturer shall use the following methods to collect data for an emission:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of mainstream smoke, the applicable official method set out in column 2 of Schedule 2; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of sidestream smoke, the applicable official method set out in column 2 of Schedule 3.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Conditions for the collection of data
Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection (2), both of the following conditions are to be used to determine the amount of an emission:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the conditions set out in the International Organization for Standardization standard ISO 3308, Third Edition 1991-10-15, entitled Routine analytical cigarette-smoking machine — Definitions and standard conditions, 1991 (E); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the conditions referred to in paragraph (a), but modified in the following manner:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: puff volume must be increased from 35 mL to 55 mL,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: puff interval must be decreased from 60 s to 30 s, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: all ventilation holes must be blocked by placing over them a strip of Mylar adhesive tape, Scotch Brand product no. 600 Transparent Tape, and the tape must be cut so that it covers the circumference and is tightly secured from the end of the filter to the tipping overwrap seam, or by another method of equivalent efficiency.

Subsection.Text: The report shall also set out the pH level of the mainstream smoke, determined in accordance with Official Method T-113, entitled Determination of Mainstream Tobacco Smoke pH, made by the Department of Health, dated December 31, 1999.
The report shall be submitted

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a report in respect of the emissions of tar, nicotine and carbon monoxide in the mainstream and sidestream smoke produced from the combustion of a cigarette or an equivalent unit of cigarette tobacco

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in relation to the conditions set out in paragraph (6)(b), for the period beginning on January 1 and ending on June 30 of a year, on or before July 31 of that year, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in relation to the conditions set out in paragraph (6)(a), for the period beginning on July 1 and ending on December 31 of a year, on or before January 31 of the following year; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the report in respect of all other emissions in the mainstream and sidestream smoke or the short report referred to in subsection (9), annually on or before January 31 of the year following the year covered by the report.

Subsection.Text: A manufacturer may, instead of submitting the report described in subsection (1) for a designated tobacco product, submit, every two years, a report on the amount of tar, nicotine, carbon monoxide, benzene, hydrogen cyanide and formaldehyde emissions contained in the smoke produced from the designated tobacco product if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of cigarettes, cigarette tobacco and tobacco sticks, including any cigarettes, cigarette tobacco or tobacco sticks sold in kits, the manufacturer’s total sales for that product in the year preceding the period covered by the report is less than 1% of the total sales of that product in that year in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of leaf tobacco and kreteks, the manufacturer’s total sales of that product in the year preceding the period covered by the report is less than 5% of the total sales of that product in that year in Canada.

Subsection.Text: The report, other than a report in respect of the emissions of tar, nicotine and carbon monoxide, is not required for a designated tobacco product if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the product is one of identical products of the manufacturer sold under different brands; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a report under this section is submitted in respect of another of those identical products.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exemption — functional relationship of certain emissions
Subsection.Text: A manufacturer may, on or before December 1 of the year preceding the year for which the exemption is sought, apply to the Minister for an exemption from the requirement to submit a report under subsection (1) in respect of the emissions for mainstream or sidestream smoke of a brand of a designated tobacco product specified by the manufacturer, if the manufacturer provides to the Minister the content and results of a statistical analysis done under the conditions referred to in subsection (12), that demonstrates, within a 95% confidence limit and in relation to the type of emission exemption sought, the existence of a functional linear relationship

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: between tar and each of the other emissions, other than nicotine, produced from the combustion of the designated tobacco product

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: by using the following formula:

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the amount of the other emission,
is the mean amount of tar as determined by 7 replicates, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by applying a regression analysis to the results obtained under subparagraph (i), and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: by applying an F-test to the results obtained under that subparagraph; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: between nicotine and the other emissions produced from the combustion of the designated tobacco product, by making the calculation and applying the analysis and test described in paragraph (a), except that the references to “tar” in subparagraph (i), other than in the description of “y”, shall be read as references to “nicotine”.

Subsection.Text: The conditions under which the statistical analysis to be provided in subsection (11) are as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of mainstream smoke, under the conditions set out in paragraphs (6)(a) and (b); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of sidestream smoke, under the conditions set out in paragraph (6)(a).

Subsection.Text: To qualify for an exemption under subsection (11), the manufacturer must submit to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a sample that must be composed of at least 28 different brands and 2 standard samples of a type of the designated tobacco product that represent the range of tar and nicotine deliveries for that type of designated tobacco product as determined

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of mainstream smoke, in accordance with Official Method T-115, entitled Determination of “Tar”, Nicotine and Carbon Monoxide in Mainstream Tobacco Smoke, made by the Department of Health, dated December 31, 1999, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of sidestream smoke, in accordance with Official Method T-212 entitled Determination of “Tar” and Nicotine in Sidestream Tobacco Smoke, made by the Department of Health, dated December 31, 1999;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the brands of the designated tobacco product for which the application for exemption is made; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the properties of the designated tobacco product, such as the type of tobacco, type of filter and characteristics of a cigarette paper, which demonstrate the functional linear relationship between

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the brands of the designated tobacco product that form the sample, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: one or more of the brands of the designated tobacco product for which the application for exemption is made.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection (13), two or more manufacturers may combine their designated tobacco products to produce a joint sample for the purpose of analyzing the sample in accordance with that subsection.
The Minister shall, without delay, decide to accept or reject

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an application made under subsection (11), based on the

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: methodology used, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the demonstration of a satisfactory functional linear relationship based on

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the mean and standard deviations of the amount of each of the emissions, other than tar and nicotine,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the estimates and 95% confidence limits for the slope “m” and the intercept “b” referred to in subparagraph (11)(a)(i),

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: regression statistics, including the degree of freedom for error, degree of freedom for regression, mean square regression, mean square error and the F statistic, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: the fact that the data must fall under a 95% prediction interval; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a sample made in accordance with subsection (13) or (14), based on the methodology used and the representativeness of the sample.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph (15)(a), a satisfactory functional linear relationship exists if a linear model demonstrates a significant portion of the variation of the other emissions about the mean of those other emissions, with a statistical significance of less than 0.01.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: cigarette means any roll or tubular construction that contains tobacco, has a wrapper or cover made of paper and is consumed through the inhalation of the products of combustion but does not include a bidi, cigar, kretek or tobacco stick. (cigarette)
identical cigarettes means cigarettes that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contain identical ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are manufactured in an identical manner;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: have identical dimensions; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: perform in an identical manner under the same conditions. (cigarettes identiques)

Subsection.Text: Every manufacturer shall perform toxicity testing in accordance with subsection (6) on every brand of cigarettes that it manufactures after December 31, 2004 and before October 1, 2005.

After September 30, 2005, for every period beginning on January 1 of a year and ending on December 31 of the same year, every manufacturer shall perform toxicity testing in accordance with subsection (6) on every brand of cigarettes that it manufactures during that period.
The manufacturer shall submit a report of the test results to the Minister on or before January 31 of the year following the year in which the tested cigarettes were manufactured.
The report shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of manufacture of the cigarettes tested, the name of the testing laboratory, the start and end dates of the tests, the results of the tests and the name of the applicable Department of Health official method used for the tests;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a report on the initial testing required by subsection (1), the results, if known, of the ignition propensity tests conducted on cigarettes of the same brand using ASTM International method E2187 — 04, dated July 1, 2004 and entitled Standard Test Method for Measuring the Ignition Strength of Cigarettes; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of all laboratory reports.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Number of replicates of a sample
Subsection.Text: The results of the tests performed in accordance with paragraph (6)(a) or (b) shall be based on three replicates of a sample.
The toxicity data shall be collected using the following test methodologies:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: Department of Health Official Method T–501, entitled Bacterial Reverse Mutation Assay for Mainstream Tobacco Smoke, as amended from time to time;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: Department of Health Official Method T–502, entitled Neutral Red Uptake Assay for Mainstream Tobacco Smoke, as amended from time to time; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: Department of Health Official Method T-503, entitled In Vitro Micronucleus Assay for Mainstream Tobacco Smoke, as amended from time to time.

Subsection.Text: The sampling of cigarettes for the toxicity testing shall be performed in accordance with the procedures described in items A and B of Table 1 of the International Organization for Standardization standard ISO 8243, second edition, dated October 15, 1991 and entitled Cigarettes — Sampling.

The cigarettes to be used in the toxicity testing shall be conditioned in an environment as described in the International Organization for Standardization standard ISO 3402, fourth edition, dated December 15, 1999 and entitled Tobacco and Tobacco Products — Atmosphere for Conditioning and Testing.
A manufacturer is not required to perform the testing and submit the report in respect of a particular brand of cigarettes if the manufacturer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sells identical cigarettes under more than one brand, including the particular brand;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: submits a report under this section in respect of another of those brands of identical cigarettes and that brand is specified in the report as being the reference brand; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: specifies in the report that is submitted in respect of the reference brand the other brands of identical cigarettes that are also covered by the report, including the particular brand.

Subsection.Text: Every manufacturer of a consumer tobacco product shall report annually on each research activity that was undertaken, continued or completed during a year by or on behalf of the manufacturer in respect of that consumer tobacco product, including, but not limited to, research regarding

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its toxicity;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its health effects;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its taste and flavour;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: its modification;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: its marketing; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the manner in which it is used by consumers.

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: The report shall be submitted on or before January 31 of the following year.

Subsection.Text: The report shall set out the following information in respect of each research activity:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the cover page of any relevant document;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any progress report, synopsis or outline made in respect of the activity; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the expected duration of the activity, the date it began and the expected date of completion.

Subsection.Text: Every manufacturer shall report annually the information described in subsection (2) in respect of each research activity related to the development of a new consumer tobacco product undertaken, continued or completed during a year by or on behalf of the manufacturer. The report shall be submitted on or before January 31 of the following year.
Every manufacturer of a consumer tobacco product shall report

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection 18(2), quarterly and at the following times, the dates of release of any promotional activity in respect of that consumer tobacco product and the applicable descriptive information set out in sections 17 to 24:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for the period beginning on January 1 and ending on March 31 of a year, on or before April 30 of that year;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the period beginning on April 1 and ending on June 30 of a year, on or before July 31 of that year;

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the period beginning on July 1 and ending on September 30 of a year, on or before October 31 of that year;

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: for the period beginning on October 1 and ending on December 31 of a year, on or before January 31 of the following year.

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: semi-annually, the information described in subsection (2) in respect of each promotional activity undertaken by the manufacturer or for the manufacturer for consideration in respect of that consumer tobacco product

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for the period beginning on January 1 and ending on June 30 of a year, on or before July 31 of that year, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the period beginning on July 1 and ending on December 31 of a year, on or before January 31 of the following year.

Subsection.Text: In addition to the information to be reported under sections 17 to 24, the semi-annual report mentioned in paragraph (1)(b) shall set out, for each province and specifying national totals,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by brand family and, where applicable, by brand

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the total semi-annual costs of each of the promotional activities described in sections 17 to 24, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: by type of consumer tobacco product, the total semi-annual costs of all promotional activities; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of all of the manufacturer’s promotional activities for all of their consumer tobacco products, the total semi-annual costs of those promotional activities.

Subsection.Text: If a consumer tobacco product is advertised in a publication, the manufacturer of that product shall report the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: every province in which the publication was distributed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the dates the advertisement was published; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the total cost of the advertisement.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer shall attach to the report a copy or a reasonable facsimile with a detailed description of any advertisement reported under subsection (1).

If a consumer tobacco product-related brand element is displayed, before October 1, 2003, in a promotion that is used in the sponsorship of a person, entity, event, activity or permanent facility, the manufacturer of the consumer tobacco product shall report the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the sponsorship is in respect of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a person or an entity, the name of the person or entity and a description of any items bearing the consumer tobacco product-related brand element of the manufacturer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an event or activity, a description of the event or activity and its date, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a permanent facility, the name of the facility, a description of it and its street address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether the consumer tobacco product-related brand element was displayed between January 25, 1996 and April 25, 1997 in promotional material that was used in the sponsorship of an event or activity that took place in Canada and, if so, the date of the event or activity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a copy or reasonable facsimile with a detailed description of any promotional material containing a brand element of the manufacturer, including, with respect to the promotional material,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the colours used in it,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its size, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of any text appearing in it;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the expected duration of the display of any promotional material used in the sponsorship;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if promotional material used in the sponsorship appears in a publication, the information required by section 17; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the total cost of the sponsorship.

Subsection.Text: The material required in paragraph (1)(c) must be provided no later than the date of its release.

Section.Text: If a consumer tobacco product-related brand element, or the name of a manufacturer, is displayed, on or after October 1, 2003, on a permanent facility where the brand element or name is not thereby associated with a sport or cultural event or activity, the manufacturer of the consumer tobacco product shall report the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, the street address and a description of the facility;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the brand element or name displayed, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the colours used in it, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its size;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the expected duration of the display; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the total cost of the display.

Section.Text: Every manufacturer of a consumer tobacco product shall report, by brand and each type of package, carton or kit containing the brand, the cost of manufacturing the packaging of the consumer tobacco product.
If a service uses a consumer tobacco product-related brand element of a manufacturer for consideration by the manufacturer, the manufacturer shall report the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the service;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the service, the expected duration of the use of the consumer tobacco product-related brand element;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the province in which the consumer tobacco product-related brand element is used by the service; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the consideration given by the manufacturer for the promotion of the consumer tobacco product.

Section.Text: Every manufacturer of a consumer tobacco product that uses a sign to promote the product, specifies the manner of displaying the product at retail or pays a fee for the display of the product shall report the following information in respect of the display at retail of the product:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if a sign or display is used,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a detailed description of the sign or display,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a photo or reasonable facsimile of the sign or display, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the cost of providing the display or using the sign, including the cost of their production and distribution;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the total amount paid to retailers to display the product or sign, by province;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number of retailers, by province and by each of the following categories, that have received a fee to display the product or sign:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a convenience store, including

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an independently owned convenience store, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a grocery store,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a pharmacy,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a restaurant,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a tavern, bar or beverage room, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: any other establishment not described in subparagraphs (i) to (v); and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a sign,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of establishments, including their names and addresses, that do not permit entry to young persons and that displayed the sign; and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the period during which the sign was specified to be displayed.

Section.Text: If an accessory that displays a consumer tobacco product-related brand element is promoted, the manufacturer of that consumer tobacco product shall report the following information about the accessory:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: photograph or reasonable facsimile of it;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of it;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number sold, by province; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its cost

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: of development,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: of manufacture,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: of distribution, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: of promotion.

Section.Text: If a non-tobacco product, other than an accessory that displays a consumer tobacco product-related brand element, displays a consumer tobacco product-related brand element of a manufacturer, the manufacturer shall report the following information in respect of the non-tobacco product:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a photograph or reasonable facsimile of it;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of it;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the number sold, by province; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: its cost

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: of development,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: of manufacture,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: of distribution, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: of promotion.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.
